models.movement

Class MoveEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.Event
      • models.movement.MoveEvent

  • public class MoveEvent
extends Event
    Perform a move event.

      • MoveEvent

        public MoveEvent(double eventTime,
                 Scenario scenario,
                 MoverEntity entity)
        Class constructor.
        Parameters:
        eventTime - The simulation time at which this event should occur.
        scenario - The scenario containing data and runtime parameters.
        entity - The entity to be moved.

    • Method Detail

      • doEvent

        public Event doEvent()
        Processes the move event.
        Overrides:
        doEvent in class Event
        Returns:
        Return a reference to an event object. The assumption is that if a valid event is returned, it will be reinserted back into an event queue. If a null is returned,nothing will be added to the queue.

      • traceSummary

        private void traceSummary()
        Write some summary data to the trace file.

      • movement

        private void movement()
        Top level function form movement. It determines if the entity is able to move and initiates the move.

      • move

        private void move()
        Move the entity.

      • delayed

        private double delayed(double delay)
        This entity is currently delayed. Perform all necessary house keeping, and calculate the time that elapsed due to the delay.
        Parameters:
        delay - The time the entity has been delayed until.
        Returns:
        The mount of time that will elapse until the entity is free to move again.

      • notDelayed

        private double notDelayed()
        The entity is not delayed, so perform a move step.
        Returns:
        The time that elapses due to this step of movement.

      • getObjective

        private Coordinate getObjective()
        Get the objective location this entity is attempting to move to.
        Returns:
        A coordinate identifying where the entity is trying to move, or null if the entity has no objective.

      • changeFloors

        private boolean changeFloors()
        Determine if the entity needs to change floors before moving.
        Returns:
        True if the entity did change floors.

      • moveFlyer

        private void moveFlyer(Coordinate objective)
        The entity is a flier, so perform the movement calculations.
        Parameters:
        objective - The objective location for this entity.

      • moveGround

        private void moveGround(Coordinate objective)
        The entity is a ground mover, so perform the appropriate movement calculation.
        Parameters:
        objective - The objective location to where the entity is moving.

      • onBridge

        private void onBridge()
        Check if the entity was on a bridge and update data accordingly.

      • doMove

        private boolean doMove(Coordinate moveObjective)
        Perform the move calculation.
        Parameters:
        moveObjective - The location where the entity is attempting to move to.
        Returns:
        True if the entity moved, otherwise false.

      • checkCraters

        private double checkCraters(double speed,
                            Coordinate currentLocation,
                            Coordinate objective)
        Check if the entity's movement will cross a crater and adjust speed if necessary.
        Parameters:
        speed - The entity's current speed.
        currentLocation - The entity's current location.
        objective - The location the entity is trying to reach.
        Returns:
        The updated speed.

      • moveStep

        private double moveStep(Coordinate objective)
        Perform one step of movement.

        Note this method affects the object variables: newSpeed, newDirection, newDistance, newDelay, newLocation.

        Parameters:
        objective - The location the entity is trying to reach.
        Returns:
        The time it takes to actually move.

      • calculateDirection

        private double calculateDirection(Coordinate oldLocation,
                                  Coordinate newLocation)
        Calculate the direction of movement between the entity's current location and its new one.
        Parameters:
        oldLocation - Where the entity starts its move.
        newLocation - Where the entity ends its move.
        Returns:
        The direction in radians.

      • polUpdate

        private void polUpdate(double speed,
                       double elapsedTime)
        Update the entity's fuel based on elapsed time and entity speed.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed of the entity (kph).
        elapsedTime - The amount of time the entity moved.

        The entity didn't actually move. Update related housekeeping.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • whereToMove

        private Coordinate whereToMove()
        Determine where the entity should move to.
        Returns:
        The location the entity is trying to reach or null if it has no objective.

      • whereToCircle

        private Coordinate whereToCircle()
        Tests if the entity is following a circle order.
        Returns:
        Returns the objective location if the entity is circling, otherwise null.

      • whereToMount

        private Coordinate whereToMount()
        Tests if the entity has a mount order.
        Returns:
        The location of the carrier the entity has been ordered to mount, or null if the entity does not have a mount order.

      • whereToPit

        private Coordinate whereToPit()
        Tests if the entity has a pit order.
        Returns:
        The location of the pit the entity has been ordered to mount, or null if the entity does not have a pit order.

      • whereToRoute

        private Coordinate whereToRoute()
        Test if the entity has a valid movement route to follow.
        Returns:
        The location of the first node in the route if it has one or null if it does not.

      • whereToFormation

        private Coordinate whereToFormation()
        Test to see if the entity is part of a formation.
        Returns:
        The location the entity should occupy relative to the formation leader or null if it is not part of a formation.

      • whereTo

        private Coordinate whereTo()
        Determine where the entity is trying to move to. This first considers a move order, then whether the entity has been ordered to mount, then whether it has been ordered to occupy a pit, then if it has a movement route and finally if it is part of a formation. This order determines the priority of which objective will be selected.
        Returns:
        A location to move to if one exists, otherwise null.

      • checkHold

        private void checkHold()
        Check if the hold time for this entity has elapsed.
